intro: Pyrola corbierei, commonly known as the Corbière wintergreen, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in early spring. Pyrola corbierei thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Its leaves remain green throughout the winter, contributing to its common name.
